Frasca is this historic dining tradition
in northeastern Italy whereby small
farms would hang little branch out on
the mailbox of a country road and
indicates people driving by they could
pull in for that local family's cuisine
and wine Frasca historically really was
the neighborhood place to eat and that's
always been our philosophy we looked to
Italy for inspiration and fell in love
with this one particular area Frehley is
a really unique region right because it
has the sea the inland wine country
foothills in the mountains all within
about a hundred and fifty K as the crow
flies so it truly is just this insane
intersection of cultures language food
traditions as well as have a huge range
of wines unlike many other parts of
Italy and even some other parts of
Europe every day we huddle up for 34
pre-service go over every single guest
that's coming in to best prepare the
entire team front and back of the house
for an amazing night and that's our
ritual our ultimate goal it says be the
greatest neighborhood restaurant in the
world and doing it through the lens of
this particular area in Italy and on
this historic feeling of a Frasca where
you where you just know everybody the
main characteristic of the Greek
lifestyle is miraculous enjoying always
the best best products best company best
places not fancy ones natural things
carrot and i--i is the crown of the

consomme we moved on from there to some

maybe modernize it slightly from there
we moved on to this Highland beef this
really amazing producer who keeps his
cows right up on the hills it's really
easy to buy beef it's actually really
hard to buy really good beef really the
only way to access something like this
is through knowing the producer through
having a really steady working
relationship you have to think that this
piece of beef is from a 12-year old cow
that means a farmer has looked after
that animal for 12 years and in order to
access that amount of hard work they
have to know that you're gonna treat
that with the due respect once it comes
into the kitchen and they have to know
that you're also gonna communicate that
to the guests that the guests are really
going to understand what they're eating

within 300 miles that's our own rule
that we have established a lot of my

sight of what seasonality is it requires
all of us working together to make
